definitions.definition: To run or flow (especially of liquids and more particularly blood ).
examples: The oil coursed through the engine.
Blood pumped around the human body courses throughout all its veins and arteries.

definitions.definition: To pursue by tracking or estimating the course taken by one's prey; to follow or chase after.
To cause to chase after or pursue game.

main_definition: To run or flow (especially of liquids and more particularly blood ).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To run through or over.
( transitive ) To pursue by tracking or estimating the course taken by one's prey; to follow or chase after.
( transitive ) To cause to chase after or pursue game.
